nodes.name: 1. Monitor ASA Failover Status
2. Retrieving the CLI commands of Failover

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Monitor failover status and highlight detail items on map.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) Failover Status
			2) Last Failover Time

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status
			2) Sync Status

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Failover Status (primary->green;secondary->gray)

		Highlight items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status (normal->green;others->red)
"}]}

			2) Last Failover Time

		Data unit items on interface level:

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Failover Status (primary->green;secondary->gray)

		Highlight items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status (normal->green;others->red)

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
Checking the Failover Status of Cisco ASA

In modern data centers, uptime is one of the most important factor. With the feature of failover, Cisco ASA provides high availability to the network environment to ensure the high uptime and the redundancy.

This runbook is designed to check the failover status of Cisco ASA.
1.	 Monitoring the failover status
2.	 Retrieving the detailed failover information

References:
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/91336-pix-activeactive-config.html"},"insert":"Failover Troubleshoot"},{"insert":"
"}]}

Checking the Failover Status of Cisco ASA

In modern data centers, uptime is one of the most important factors. With the feature of failover, Cisco ASA provides high availability to the network environment to ensure the high uptime and the redundancy.

This runbook is designed to check the failover status of Cisco ASA.
1.	 Monitoring the failover status

{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Monitor ASA Failover Status"},{"insert":"

Monitoring the failover status

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Required Inputs (from user) :"},{"insert":"
	Any Qmap
 
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Outputs:"},{"insert":"
	The failover status will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring). 
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0047b2"},"insert":" "},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Related Commands:"},{"insert":"
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco ASA firewall:
show failover"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"}]}

Required Inputs (from user) :
	Any Qmap

	The failover status will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring). 
 
Related Commands:

	1) Cisco ASA firewall:
show failover

Retrieving the CLI commands of Failover

Monitor ASA Failover Status

Monitoring the failover status

Required Inputs (from user) :
	Any Qmap
 
Outputs:
	The failover status will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring). 
 
Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco ASA firewall:
show failover

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Monitor failover status and highlight detail items on map.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) Failover Status
			2) Last Failover Time

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status
			2) Sync Status

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Failover Status (primary->green;secondary->gray)

		Highlight items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status (normal->green;others->red)
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Monitor failover status and highlight detail items on map.

Output:
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) Failover Status
			2) Last Failover Time

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status
			2) Sync Status

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Failover Status (primary->green;secondary->gray)

		Highlight items on interface level:
			1) Interface Status (normal->green;others->red)

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
Checking the Failover Status of Cisco ASA

In modern data centers, uptime is one of the most important factors. With the feature of failover, Cisco ASA provides high availability to the network environment to ensure the high uptime and the redundancy.

This runbook is designed to check the failover status of Cisco ASA.
1.	 Monitoring the failover status
2.	 Retrieving the detailed failover information

References:
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/91336-pix-activeactive-config.html"},"insert":"Failover Troubleshoot"},{"insert":"
"}]}
